conclusion: Particle A's velocity peaks at 2v0 at t0, drops to zero at 2t0, rises again to 2v0 at 3t0, and then drops back to zero at 4t0, and stays at zero beyond that.

Particle A has two triangular velocity peaks, one from t=0 to t=t0 rising to 2v0, then from t=t0 to t=2t0 decreasing to zero, then from t=2t0 to t=3t0 increasing to 2v0 again, and from t=3t0 to t=4t0 decreasing to zero.
